website_summaries.verdict: Cymbal set made from hand-hammered B20 alloy and polished to a brilliant shine.
pros: Crisp, clean sound that can even handle jazz and blues, along with many other musical styles
The crash and ride in particular get extra high marks from some users
cons: Not appropriate for thrashing or an extra-loud sound, as cymbals are a bit on the thinner side

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my husband and he never imagined he'd own cymbals this good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he says: Haven't had these long, but from the moment I unboxed them I was sold. I've only used low-end cymbals in the past. These are monsters, heavy and beautiful. The hats have a nice stick sizzle, but less definition than I'd like with the pedal alone. It may be technique; I'm no master. The crash isn't painful, just loud and a tiny bit splashy. I like it. The ride is gong-y. I may damp it a little. Big sound, lo-o-o-o-o-o-o-ong sustain, with little or no wah in the decay. I still dream of Zildjian K Constantinoples, but for this price, I never imagined I'd own cymbals this good.
customer_reviews.author: Sue L. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Bronze Sound
customer_reviews.text: This set sounds great. Bronze 80/20, not brass. Bronze is copper/tin. Brass is copper/zinc. Zinc sounds dull and rather thud like. Bronze with tin has a much more musical ring tone to it. Do yourself a favor, skip the brass cymbals and buy bronze cymbals. These Wuhans are GREAT sounding 80/20 bronze cymbals AND a good price. You will love their sounds.
customer_reviews.author: P. CaffallDavis

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Hi-Hats: Crisp, Bright, Clear. Very versatile. Think Sabian AAX. Crash: Dark, Washy, Incredibly unique. Great as an accent crash. Ride (Medium/Heavy): Pingy- think rock ride. Doesn't crash well but very good for cutting through a mix. Overall, for the money you can't beat this. I bought these as a practice set and they're perfect for that but the hats could easily be used for recordings and certain live settings. Would suggest listening to some sound demos on youtube, but even then no cymbal sounds the same. If you're a beginner, these are such a steal. even if you're advanced, they are a good set to have in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: giacomo agostini

customer_reviews.title: Wuhan - always amazing quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Knew these were gonna be 5-star before they came in. Wuhan has long been my favorite cymbal brand due to their very unique sound. Then to top off everything else, they're priced like ZBT packs with a quality sound that, in my opinion, beats all top shelf cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Edge Trader

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The hi-hats are the best of the bunch. Crisp. Good sound with the pedal and playing open and closed. The crash is very responsive. A bit of a darker tone to it. Can't really complain about it. The ride could use a bit of work. There's very little control. The bell sound is well-defined but the rest of the ride acts more like a crash/ride than a true ride. These cymbals are so much better than the lower end offerings of any of the big brands. If you're mainly playing at home, just get these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but the packing was so poor that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value, but the packing was so poor that I returned a damaged set where the cymbals were partially thru the box. The second set I received seemed okay despite the fact that the box had no protection packing. The hihats were a big upgrade over my B8 Sabian cymbals. The 16" crash sounds nice. The Ride is a little too bright for my taste, but a bargain at this price.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: Wuhan cymbal pack
customer_reviews.text: Im 58 years young and have played the drums since 14. I just received the cymbal pack and the hi hats sound great, nice chick and stick play cuts through. They sound great open too. The ride has good response and the bell sounds great. Not overly washy depending on how you play it. The 16" Crash is dead is and sounds a little thick, even though it says thin. A little gongy to me. I may expirement with it a little! Although I haven't played out with them yet, I'll give them a 4 out of 5. The ride and hi hats sound as good as I've had. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine set. I'm a beginner but not a kid
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine set. I'm a beginner but not a kid, and I appreciate the value/cost ratio. These are good cymbals but are not cheap. They don't sound like custom pro-quality cymbals, but they aren't low-end garbage either. They're good cymbals and for what I paid ($200ish), they're excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Had Sabian B8's and am too cheap to spring for expensive cymbals. What a great way to get B20s! Yup, they are different than B8's. And I like 'em all. Struck hard or soft they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like these cymbals because of their sound and finish. The set is a huge step up from the stamped brands / versions in the same price range. As others have mentioned, the HH's are the weak link but sound good enough for practice, etc. Flimsy bag but it gets the job done. I'm not a great drummer (steady beat and stay out of the way) so I kind-of like the Wuhan vibe vs. the BIG brands. Again, overall a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: G. J. Vrazo

customer_reviews.title: Good cymbal and good price
customer_reviews.text: Fun cymbal. No complaints. I've played live shows with these with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at an extremely affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: You can't really beat these for the money. These sound awesome for what they are. I have switched to all Wuhan on my practice set.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the drummer on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot better than many higher end cymbals I've used. If you're looking to get a good starter cymbal pack or upgrade the cheap cymbals that came with your set, these are for you. And all Wuhan cymbals are 100% hand made - something you won't find in any cymbals in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Rain Dog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: These cymbals really are great for the price. For lower end kits, the cymbals are like banging on aluminum pie pans. These are sturdy, can take a good beating with out bending, and have great sound. Don't let the low price scare you off.
customer_reviews.author: DM Watson

customer_reviews.title: Worth your cash!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid set of cymbals at beginner's level pricing. Don't buy into branding. These cymbals sound fantastic and are practically being given away at this price. Nothing else in this price range even comes close. Well done, Wuhan. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for the money. Cast, lathed and hammered B20 bronze cymbals at a price less than some brass cymbals stamped from sheet. No they're not Zildjians, Sabians, or AGOPS, but they are real cymbals and would work in many settings. I'm a 66 year old drummer wannabe and was looking for some good, but reasonably priced cymbals to augment a rock kit. I have Zildjian K Constantinople cymbals on my jazz kit, but was blown away by how nice sounding and well suited the Wuhans were for my rock setup. A little too bright for jazz IMO, but perfect for rock, funk, blues and metal and a wonderful option for drummer on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Set
customer_reviews.text: I was on a budget and purchased these since I've had experience with their Chinas. Love the way they sound (trashy and china-ish). Sound pretty good when recording. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Wikoli

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for a 2nd kit so I won't have to move some many items...this set sounds as good as or better than Sabian SBT, B8, or the lower end Ziljain. They are no paragon series Sabian but for the price they sound very good (the crash rings a bit but ride and HH sound good) I have 4 other Wuhan china and splash cymbals and will be ordering a 22" china/crash soon That said I do think the higher quality ride, "main" crash, and HH are a must for the master....but these are fine to jam with friends and small setting no mics
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Save alot for a very good sound. Stands strong on your drum kit along side more expensive brands. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Joe V. Macaluso

customer_reviews.title: ... several reviews stating that these were one of the best cymbal sets to purchase under $300
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered these cymbals based off of several reviews stating that these were one of the best cymbal sets to purchase under $300.00 These cymbals did not meet the expectations once they were set up with the drum kit. The hi-hats were very thin and tinny sounding. The crash had a very trashy china sound and did not sound like a crash at all. The ride cymbal was decent and was the best cymbal out of the entire set. These were immediately returned due to sound quality they produced.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the price
customer_reviews.text: No frills here. Fantastic for the price. They sound better then expected, beating out B8pro and intro Zildjians. I am going to use only Wuhan from now on
customer_reviews.author: Rich1012

customer_reviews.title: Very Surprised, love these!
customer_reviews.text: Just tried out this cymbal pack and love them. Great bright sound. Skip all the B8 cymbals like ZBT, Sabian B8 and all the rest. Nice pro sounding cymbals at a fraction of the price. Make no mistake these are not Zildjian A's but for the money as close as you're going to get. Realy pleasantly surprised. I'm going to pick up the 14,16,18 to add to the mix. I'm going to be playing full blown Wuhan.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set that does not sound like a starter set.
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Cheaper than the Sabian B8 series but sound better I think. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm a convert.....Wuhan has my vote!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned about every brand of cymbal out there......and these sound great! By far the most quality for your dollar. Have already added China and Splash to the Wuhan conversion....great choice. Crisp hi hat......clean crash....rich ride...outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Puckett

customer_reviews.title: They're great and unique
customer_reviews.text: They're great and unique. If you are looking for a cheat cymbal with a great sound don't think twice and buy this.
customer_reviews.author: LTollinchi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money$$
customer_reviews.text: So my Cymbal pack showed up yesterday and pretty excited to hear the new sound. The ride has a good sound along with the bell I found it somewhat hard to control when playing a softer beat but happy with the sound, the crash very crisp. powerfull and makes a great combo with a China boy, the high hat set good sound but somewhat didn't get the playing power I was looking for as for the heavy one goes on the bottom I tried switching them with no luck still have a few adjustments with the clutch, overall for the money great buy and sound exp if you dont have the money to invest , Rock on...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great set of cymbals for the money!
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago, I picked up a used Wuhan 16" Crash, and was pleasantly surprised with the sound. Recently, I was looking for an inexpensive set of cymbals, and decided to give this set a shot. I purchased it at another site, and my set came with the 18" Crash/Ride as well. All of the cymbals sound great....not quite as good as my K Customs, but a lot better than a set of ZHT's or B8's. They are hand hammered, so different cymbals of the same size will have slight variations in tone, but for a beginner this is an excellent buy!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These cymbals are amazing. I'd say they're as good as, if not better than, any cymbals that you'd be 100-200 dollars more for. I've tried (hard) to shop around for other brand cymbals to make sure I'm getting what I want when buying new cymbals, and these easily trump anything else I can find without going way above my price range.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanial Fennen

customer_reviews.title: Love the ride and the crash is good
customer_reviews.text: It's worth it. Give it a chance and you'll see. Hi Hats are not that loud. Love the ride and the crash is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kerron01

customer_reviews.title: Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: For $250.00 these are a great buy!.....and they sound very good as well.....
customer_reviews.author: dan kephart

product_meta.title: Wuhan WUTBSU Western Style Cymbal Set with Cymbal Bag
product_meta.description: This Wuhan Cymbal Package includes the Western Style 14 Hi Hats, 16 Crash, and 20 Ride. Wuhan cymbals don't presume to challenge the sound quality, variety, and reputation of the fine professional-level cymbals on today's market. Wuhan cymbals instead give you quality with a price that won't empty your wallet. Generally, affordable cymbals are made of less-expensive sheet alloys, using short-cut manufacturing methods and finishing steps in order to keep the cost down. And with the resulting cymbals you pretty much get what you pay for. Wuhan cymbals are made of high-quality cast B20 alloy. They're handcrafted in China according to two-thousand-year-old traditional methods. They're buffed to a brilliant finish, and stamped with an unobtrusive but attractive logo.
feature_bullets: Hand hammered, lathed, and highly polished.
This Wuhan Cymbal Package includes the Western Style 14" Hi Hats, 16" Crash, and 20" Ride.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars67 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
